field_reports.epi_notes_since_last_fr:
Dès la déclaration de l'Epidémie à Loukoléla Zaïre zone transfrontalière avec Loukoléla Congo, les autorités Congolaises ont lancé l'alerte sur une surveillance épidémiologique dans les district de Loukoléla, Mossaka et L'Ile Mbamou tous des zones transfrontalières avec des activités commerciales très intense.
Malgré l'alerte, 06 cas sont détectés dont 04 à Loukoléla et 06 à Mossaka, tous décédés.
Au regard de toutes les mesures préventives, l'épidémie s'est propagé jusqu'à atteindre l'île mbamou, l'une des porte d'entrée de la ville Capitale Brazzaville.
field_reports.description:
This confirmation of the cholera epidemic in our country comes in a regional context marked by the resurgence of cholera in neighboring countries, particularly in Angola, with confirmed cases in the province of Kabinda and in the Democratic Republic of Congo with confirmed cases in Kinshasa and in the province of Equateur (Loukoléla zaire).
In any case, suspects and even confirmed are quarantined in the nearest health centers with a great need for appropriate medical assistance.
This situation is once again affecting the Congolese health system, which on the eve of its independence day is confronted with this scourge. 
To date, the rapid and unusual increase in the number of cases is possible in the localities of the island of Mbamou, Loukoléla and Mossaka due to the period of fairground markets.

results.summary:
This confirmation of the cholera epidemic in our country comes in a regional context marked by the resurgence of cholera in neighboring countries, particularly in Angola, with confirmed cases in the province of Kabinda and in the Democratic Republic of Congo with confirmed cases in Kinshasa and in the province of Equateur (Loukoléla zaire).
In any case, suspects and even confirmed are quarantined in the nearest health centers with a great need for appropriate medical assistance.
This situation is once again affecting the Congolese health system, which on the eve of its independence day is confronted with this scourge. 
To date, the rapid and unusual increase in the number of cases is possible in the localities of the island of Mbamou, Loukoléla and Mossaka due to the period of fairground markets.
results.name: COG: Epidemic - 07-2025 - CHOLERA EPIDEMIC

appeals.sector: Country cluster for Democratic Republic of Congo, Republic of Congo, Burundi and Rwanda

results.summary:
Two ethnic groups, the Nounous and the Tekés, living in the DRC Mai-Ndombe province, have been ghting over land for years. On
Sunday 09 February 2025, a Nounou traditional chief was assassinated by the Tekés, triggering a conict that led to killings and forced the
population to move to Congo-Brazzaville. These people have taken refuge in the districts and villages of Ngabé, Mpouya, Gamboma,
Bouémba, Mossaka and Makotimpoko, which are in the North Pool department, a basin and plateau bordering the DRC.
On February 11, 2025, there were 8,779 displaced persons from the DRC, and as of February 14, 2025, the number of displaced persons
had risen to 18,296, according to the Ministry of Social Aairs. On this same date, the Ministry of Social Aairs, Solidarity and
Humanitarian Action of the Republic of Congo requested the support of the Congolese government's partners, to respond to the massive
population movements in the DRC.
A total of 3,049 households were received by the Congolese government and accommodated in reception centers, schools, churches,
some with host families.
results.name: Congo Population Movement 2025

field_reports.summary: COG: Flood - 12-2023 - FLOOD IN CONGO BRAZZAVILLE
field_reports.description:
Currently, the populations of the city of Pointe-Noire in the south and its surroundings are experiencing an unusual overflow of water from November until today, it rains every day, torrential rains repeatedly. The cross-referenced information (the Mayor of Pointe-Noire, the CAS of Pointe-Noire, Departmental Council of the CRC of Pointe-Noire) in our possession, shows that more than 18910 people are affected in the city of Pointe-Noire and its surroundings 8964 homeless.

It should be noted that some of the affected families are accommodated by a few host families living in the few elevated areas of the ocean city, in certain schools and religious sites placed on high ground. In the city of Pointe-Noire, the Congolese Red Cross mobilized for first aid.  

In view of the above, the current situation requires an in-depth multi-sectoral assessment that will enable the Congolese Red Cross to organize effective assistance in the targeted areas, with the support of the Movement's partners Red Cross

results.summary:
The Republic of Congo has been facing exceptionally severe rainfall over almost all of the national territory for several weeks. According to experts, this precipitation is twice as much as the usual average. This situation is at the root of the floods in the country, which already has 320,891 people directly affected by the floods, subject to displacement and severe losses as a result of this disaster.

 

The most affected departments are mainly Likouala, Sangha, Cuvette, Plateaux, Niari, Brazzaville and Pointe-Noire (large torrential rains), with 361 villages and 36 neighborhoods submerged due to the exceptional flooding of the Congo River and its tributaries. The impact of the rains to date on the population already far exceeds the number of affected populations over the period of OND during the floods in 2021 (164,679 personnes_Evaluation with the Government) and 2022 (222,000 people).

Floods caused 17 deaths in the departments of the Likouala, Plateaux, Brazzaville and Pointe-Noire.

6 people are missing in the departments of Likouala and Cuvette. In total, more than 2,292 hectares of land are flooded.
results.name: COG: Flood - 12-2023 - FLOOD IN CONGO BRAZZAVILLE

field_reports.summary: COG: Other - 2023-07 - Cholera Epidemic - Shigellosis and Tyhoid Fever
field_reports.description:
The city of Dolisie, in the Republic of Congo, is in epidemic of cholera, shigellosis and typhoid fever, following the appearance of a disease that already causes 12 deaths, said Monday night the Congolese government, urging departments not yet in epidemic to "put themselves on alert".
On July 18, 2023, the government indicates that Dolisie, capital of the Congolese department of Niari, is in epidemic of cholera, shigellosis and typhoid fever, due to the health situation of the city, marked by a disease, with to date 1,365 suspected cases, including 12 deaths, according to a statement from the Ministry of Health.

In order to reduce the spread of this epidemic in the departments of Niari and Pointe-Noire, the local Red Cross of Niari actively participates in the various inter-agency coordination meetings and contributes to the active surveillance of cases, contact monitoring and social mobilization and the prevention of hygiene rules.
To do this, the local Red Cross deployed 10 teams of 5 Volunteers in the town of Dolisie with 5 supervisors;

results.summary: The city of Dolisie, in the Republic of Congo, is in epidemic of cholera, shigellosis and typhoid fever, following the appearance of a disease that already causes 12 deaths, said Monday night the Congolese government, urging departments not yet in epidemic to "put themselves on alert". On July 18, 2023, the government indicates that Dolisie, capital of the Congolese department of Niari, is in epidemic of cholera, shigellosis and typhoid fever, due to the health situation of the city, marked by a disease, with to date 1,365 suspected cases, including 12 deaths, according to a statement from the Ministry of Health. In order to reduce the spread of this epidemic in the departments of Niari and Pointe-Noire, the local Red Cross of Niari actively participates in the various inter-agency coordination meetings and contributes to the active surveillance of cases, contact monitoring and social mobilization and the prevention of hygiene rules. To do this, the local Red Cross deployed 10 teams of 5 Volunteers in the town of Dolisie with 5 supervisors.
results.name: COG: Other - 2023-07 - Cholera Epidemic - Shigellosis and Tyhoid Fever

appeals.sector: Country cluster for Democratic Republic of Congo, Republic of Congo, Burundi and Rwanda

field_reports.description:
Etant encore en pleine saison de pluie dans ce dernier trimestre de l'année en cours,  il est possible que le niveau des 'eaux augmente en quantité inestimable détruisant, habitations, champs et réserves alimentaires (Volailles et bétail). Notons que les rivières Sangha et Likouala aux herbes ne seront pas dégagées et les inondations s'étendront dans toutes les localités à risque causant encore plus de dégâts. Aussi il y a un très grand risque que les maladies transmises par l'eau (choléra, malaria, fièvre jaune) prennent de l'ampleur. Compte tenu du contexte qui se présente, le risque de propagation des maladies d'origine hydrique, qui se composent de maladies fécales-orales, de maladies liées à l'eau et de maladies aquatiques, est très élevé.
Les points d'eau et latrines détruits ou inondés augmentent le manque d'accès à l'eau potable dans les départements ciblés. Ceci expose la population affectée aux épidémies et aux maladies bucco-buccales, notamment le choléra, qui s'est propagé ces dernières années dans différents districts tel que dans les départements de la Cuvette et des Plateaux.
Compte tenu de l'importance de la population dans ces deux départements, il est essentiel de prendre des mesures pour garantir leur accès à une eau potable (par exemple, par la distribution de produits de potabilisation pour le traitement de l'eau et de conteneurs de stockage), ainsi que pour gérer les épidémies (par exemple, la distribution de sachets de SRO). La situation actuelle des eaux stagnantes est très propice à la culture des vecteurs du paludisme.

results.summary:
As it is still in the middle of the rainy season in this last quarter of the current year, it is possible that the water level will rise again and spread to other localities which will lead to an extension of the flooded areas. It should be noted that rivers will not be cleared and flooding will spread to all localities at risk in the three target departments. There is also a very high risk that water-borne diseases (cholera, malaria, yellow fever) will become more widespread. Given the current context, the risk of the spread of waterborne diseases, which consist of faecal-oral diseases, water-related diseases and aquatic diseases, is very high.
Destroyed or flooded water points and latrines increase the lack of access to drinking water in the targeted departments. This exposes the affected population to epidemics and oral diseases, including cholera, which has spread in recent years in different districts of the two departments (Cuvette and Plateaux).
Given the large population in these three departments, it is essential to take measures to ensure their access to safe drinking water (e.g., through the distribution of drinking water treatment products and storage containers), as well as to manage outbreaks (e.g., the distribution of ORS sachets). The current situation of stagnant water is very conducive to the cultivation of malaria vectors.
results.name: COG: Flood - 2022-12 - Flood

field_reports.summary: COG: Inondation - 2022-11 - INONDATION COUPLEE AUX MALADIES HYDRIQUES
field_reports.description: De cette conjonction de phénomènes naturels favorables à l’inondation découle une classification des événements selon une échelle de gravité, basée sur les hauteurs des eaux et les dégâts dans les départements de la Cuvette et la Likouala dont plus de 3169 personnes souffres des maladies hydriques par manque d'eau potable. Cette situation, met la vie des populations riveraines en danger. Notons que, le Ministère de la Santé et de la Population dans son communiqué rendu publique en date du 28 Octobre 2022 confirme les cas de 02 de choléra et de 3169 maladies hydriques repartis dans les districts d'Epéna, Dongou, Enyèllè et Bétou dans le département la Likouala. Vue l'ampleur des inondations couplées aux maladies hydriques, le Ministère à solliciter l'appui des organisations humanitaires notamment la Croix-Rouge Congolaise pour un appui technique qualifié.

results.summary: This conjunction of natural phenomena favorable to flooding results in a classification of events according to a scale of severity, based on water levels and damage in the departments of Cuvette and Likouala, where more than 3169 people suffer from waterborne diseases due to lack of drinking water. This situation puts the lives of the local populations in danger. It should be noted that the Ministry of Health and Population in its press release made public on October 28, 2022 confirms the cases of 02 of cholera and 3169 waterborne diseases spread over the districts of Epéna, Dongou, Enyèllè and Bétou in the department of Likouala. Given the extent of the floods coupled with waterborne diseases, the Ministry has requested the support of humanitarian organizations, in particular the Congolese Red Cross, for qualified technical support.
results.name: COG: Flood - 2022-11 - FLOODING COUPLED WITH WATERBORNE DISEASES

field_reports.summary: COG: Inondation couplée aux maladies hydriques
field_reports.description:
De cette conjonction de phénomènes naturels favorables à l’inondation découle une classification des événements selon une échelle de gravité, basée sur les hauteurs des eaux et les dégâts dans les départements de la Cuvette, Sangha et la Likouala.  Cette situation, met la vie des populations riveraines en danger. 
Notons que, le Ministère de la Santé et de la Population dans son communiqué rendu publique en date du 28 Octobre 2022 confirme les cas de choléra et des maladies hydriques dans les villages de Yako et Eboko dans la Likouala et Kabo dans la Sangha. Vue l'ampleur des inondations couplées aux maladies hydriques, le Ministère à solliciter l'appui des organisations humanitaires.

field_reports.description:
Entre janvier 2021 et Mars 2022, plus de 4476 cas de rougeole notifiés dans 11 départements touchés. Les épicentres sont la Ville de Pointe-Noire et le District rural de Tchamba-Nzassi qui ont enregistré 3498 cas enregistrés, avec 78 décès des enfants de moins de 5ans.

La réunion du CCIA organisée le 25 Mars 2022, par le gouvernement en collaboration avec les partenaires, a permis de prendre les décisions suivantes, conformément aux recommandations de l'OMS:

1-Validation du Plan national de riposte contre la rougeole; 2- Approbation de la Campagne de suivi contre la rougeole et la rubeole;

3- Validation du chronogramme de mise en oeuvre de la campagne de vaccination préventive de masse contre la fièvre jaune.

appeals.sector: Country cluster for Democratic Republic of Congo, Republic of Congo, Burundi and Rwanda

field_reports.description: Depuis le mois de septembre 2021, d'abondantes précipitations ont été observées dans la partie septentrionale du Congo, alors que les pluies ne venaient que de commencer. Selon les données satélitaires mentionnées par le Gouvernement, le niveau des eaux a atteint de grandes proportions et a entrainé le 29 novembre 2021 l'inondation totale ou partielle de plusieurs villages, quartiers, districts des départements de la Likouala, la Sangha, la Cuvette et les Plateaux. A ces localités touchées à l'intérieur du pays s'ajoutent plusieurs quartiers de Pointe-Noire et de Brazzaville, où plusieurs milliers de personnes touchées ont été forcées de quitter leurs lieux d'habitation et perdu leurs moyens de subsistance. Face à cette catastrophe, le gouvernement congolais a déclaré un état de catastrophe par lettre N°210844/PM/CAB le 29/11/2021. Les branches Croix-Rouge Congolaise des localités touchées ont été mobilisées pour apporter secours aux personnes vulnérables et faire rapport régulièrement  au siège national sur l'évolution de la situation.

results.summary: The  Drought alert level is Green.
